Brace Sproul

 Report this post

üßëüíªExcited to announce Ambient Agents! Today we're releasing our first ambient agent of the week - an executive AI email assistant. This agent is built on top of a pattern we believe will be widely adopted throughout the agents released this year, and in years to come. Ambient agents are AI applications which can suggest actions to the user, then await your approval, feedback, or edits before executing the action. This pattern enables whole hosts of agent applications which would not have been fully trusted by users before, like an email assistant. Check out the free hosted executive AI email assistant here:  And the open source code here:

data.title: Thrilled to release what I've been working on for the past ~month ...
data.snippet:
# Brace Sproul‚Äôs Post

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI @ LangChain

 Report this post

Thrilled to release what I've been working on for the past ~month, and what we've been using for the last 3 weeks to manage, curate and post community content on LangChain's social! The social media agent has a ton of features, from verifying content is relevant, generating marketing reports, and managing image selection for you! We've made onboarding easy with our quickstart, and if you want to use all of the advanced features it supports, we have an in depth setup guide too! To top it all off, I released a YouTube video walking you through how it works, and how to set it up:  See the open source code here: 

466,872 followers [...] 9mo 

 Report this comment

üåü Congratulations on the release! It sounds like an amazing tool for managing social content! üéâ With the buzz around the TikTok ban, I think everyone should check out mybumpsocial.com! They‚Äôre creating the new TikTok of the US, and they‚Äôre a fantastic group eager to make a difference! Would love to see them get interviewed! üòä #SocialMedia #Innovation #CommunityContent #ExcitingTimes #MyBumpSocial

To view or add a comment, sign in [...] are going to push our content out based on "interest," not followers, we've got to be even clearer about who our content is for and who would like to see it in the way we deliver it. ‚Äì‚Äì 3. Community building should be the goal for our engagement strategies. When we do make a connection‚Äîwhether it's through comments on our posts, Stories, DMs, etc.‚Äîwe need to nurture that lead. That pull can be a key differentiator in a world of content push. ‚Äì‚Äì I feel like there's a bit of a disconnect between 1 and 2, because creating content that's authentic to me often means talking about the full range of things I'm engaged with. So I'm working more on number three, as I think it can be a powerful one on its own. ‚Äì‚Äì What are you doing to adapt to the evolving social media landscape these days? Read
